intro: Oxydectes agrophila, commonly known as the field oxydectes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. Oxydectes agrophila is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
